line_1: My taxes, gladly paid, their nature shift;
line_2: If just, cheap purchase; if unjust, a gift:

line_1: 'Wi' cits nor lairds I wadna shift,
line_2: 'O Thou wha gies us each guid gift!

line_1: 'Wi' cits nor lairds I wadna shift,
line_2: ' Gie me o' wit an' sense a lift,

line_1: 'Wi' cits nor lairds I wadna shift,
line_2: 'Then turn me, if Thou please, adrift,

line_1: Thus far advanc't, he made a shift
line_2: To raise a Roof with Act the Fift.

line_1: Tho' no great connoisseur, I make a shift
line_2: Just to find out a Durfey from a Swift;

line_1: An' pow't, for want o' better shift,
line_2: Poor hav'rel Will fell aff the drift,

line_1: 'To be cover'd in Flannel instead of a Shift?
line_2: 'But pray,' says I, 'TABITHA, what is your Drift
